page.title: 14THE WILMSLOW EXPRESS CONT.
page.content: It is printed in{Stockport}along with nine other regional papers owned by the Express group.They print{16,000 {copies}which are distributed by sub-contracting.The W.E.A. employs {three reporters}and{one photographer but they also receive information from the public about local news and events.As a{free newspaper}the W.E.A. relies solely on advertising for finance -50% of which is classified, 25% unclassified and the rest news.The paper only reports local news, for example the Alderley - Wilmslow by-pass,but some stories attract national interest too, for example the case of the remains of the{Iron Age {Man,}found in the{peat bog on Lindow {Marsh.
